bibl.title: Letter from Gloria Rose to Philip Showalter Hench, January 8, 1942

div1.p: Rose, the niece of Wallace Forbes, informs Hench that she has pictures of Forbes.

div1.head: Letter from Gloria Rose to Philip Showalter Hench, January 8, 1942
div1.opener:
5450 West Walton Street
Chicago, Illinois
January 8, 1942
to Chicago Ave can
transfer must on
Chicago
Dr. Philip S. Hench
102-110 Second Avenue S.W.
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
We were all extremely interested in your letter of
January 6 which was addressed to my grandmother,
Mrs. Mary Alice Forbes.

My sister and I searched hopefully through the photo-
graphs and snapshots our uncle left with grandmother
in 1920, which was the last time any of the family
heard from him. While some of these pictures are well
identified, most of them are of a general rather than
a specific nature, and we were quite disappointed in
not being able to tie them in with the men mentioned
in your address.

From what I am able to learn, it appears that my uncle
was a rather irresponsible, “devil-may-care” indivi-
dual and, like so many such people, was reticent about
his personal affairs, rarely speaking or writing of
them. Consequently, we are not very well informed
regarding his activities.

If you believe that it would be worth your while to
see the pictures (a number of them are of the Hospital
Unit) or if we can be of assistance to you in any other
way, we shall be very glad to have you get in touch
with us when you pass through Chicago on your way home.
Our telephone number is Mansfield 9865.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, Gloria Rose MR
